page.title: 11The Village of Norton
page.content: Norton was in the first Domesday Book. It was called Norton in the Moors. Before the Norman Conquest the land was held by 2 freemen named Ulviet and Godric.In 1086 there was enough farm- land for 4 ploughs.There were 9 families, each held a smallholding and had 3 ploughs between them.There was a large area of woodland. William the Conqueror gave the land to Robert de Stafford. Norton is very different now. There is some farmland but no woodland. It is a large village and alot of people live there.Everybody has a piece of land which they can do what they want with. There are not many shops but you can buy what food you want and get a small toy from the paper shop.In the park you can play tennis and have a picnic. I wonder what William would think.
